headline: Oracle Surge Lifts S&P 500 to New Record
summary: A breakneck rally in  Oracle  shares helped power the S&P 500 to another record, while a slide in  Apple  dragged down the Dow Jones Industrial Average.  The Wall Street Journal reported Wednesday afternoon that OpenAI and Oracle signed a $300 billion computing deal, among the biggest cloud contracts ever signed.  Oracle added $247 billion in market value, surpassing  JPMorgan Chase  to become the 10th-largest company by market capitalization, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

Oracle added $247 billion in market value, surpassing  JPMorgan Chase  to become the 10th-largest company by market capitalization, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

headline: /C O R R E C T I O N -- TORRAS/
summary: In today's world, the smartphone is more than a communication tool—it's our camera, diary, and creative hub. With Apple's iPhone 17 series launching this September, mobile imaging is set for another leap. The question remains: how can users fully unleash this power in everyday life? TORRAS believes the answer lies in the most overlooked accessory—a phone case.

headline: Stocks to Watch Recap: Apple, Oracle, Klarna, Synopsys

headline: Apple shows off iPhone 17: The biggest takeaways & price points
summary: Apple (AAPL) unveiled the iPhone 17 and iPhone Air its latest generation of devices — namely the the Apple Watch Ultra 3 and AirPods Pro 3 — at the company's launch event in Cupertino, California, on Tuesday. Yahoo Finance tech editor Dan Howley highlights his experience using the new iPhone and other Apple devices, their latest features, and price points for tech consumers. The iPhone 17 is scheduled to go on sale starting Friday, September 19. Catch Visible Alpha's Melissa Otto comment on Apple's stock reaction as consumers have high expectations for new AI features. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: A Key to Larry Ellison’s Wealth Creation: Years of Oracle Stock Buybacks
summary: Unlike many technology companies,  Oracle  has taken stock buybacks seriously—and that is why its chairman Larry Ellison now rivals Tesla CEO Elon Musk as the world’s wealthiest person, with an Oracle stake worth about $387 billion.  Oracle shares were up 28% to $334 Wednesday in the wake of the company’s earnings report Tuesday.  Oracle’s share count has shrunk by almost 45% over the past 15 years to 2.8 billion shares.

raw.headline: A Key to Larry Ellison’s Wealth Creation: Years of Oracle Stock Buybacks
